sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"竞争"之意。
means: compete ： 普通用词，含义广泛。既可指体育活动等活动中争取优胜的相互竞争，也可指为了自己的利益与他人竞争。
contend ： 指为战胜或击败对手进行不懈努力，强调拼搏。也可指口头上进行有对立情绪或严重分歧的争论。
contest ： 指为争夺土地、阵地、权力或荣誉等而展开的竞争。
rival ： 指在两方或多方的竞争或比赛中，谁都想战胜或比得上对手。

sentence.Network_en: They contend that the company failed to disclose material information.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们坚持认为该公司并未透露实质性的信息。

sentence.Network_en: His firm must contend with the unwieldy Russian bureaucracy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的公司必须与俄罗斯庞大的官僚机构周旋。

sentence.Network_en: It is time, once again, to contend with racism.
sentence.Network_cn: 又一次到了与种族主义战斗的时刻了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... tendency n 倾向 contend v 竞争，争论 extend v 延展，扩张.
高考英语单词最容易出错的36组_高考网 ... ) dairy 牛奶厂； ) contend 奋斗, 斗争； ) principal 校长, 主要的；.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... tendency n 倾向 contend v 竞争，争论 extend v 延展，扩张.
考博英语词汇大全(完全免费版)_百度文库 ... consul n． 领事 contend vt． 声称，主张，认为 controversy n． 争论，辩论.

list.abs: the boy contended that he saw a ghost ., 这个男孩硬说他看见了鬼.
抗_百度百科 ... （3）抗拒；拒绝[ defy;refuse] （4）匹敌，抗衡[ contend with] （5）举起[ raise].
挑拨性丑闻（The contender，美国）美国总统决定选择参议员Laine为副总统，这意味着美国即将有历史上的第一个女性副总统。
TOEFL词频表 - 豆丁网 ... contend 声称,主张 contender 竞争者 content 容量，含量.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'compete for (something'): from Old French contendre or Latin contendere, from con- 'with' + tendere 'stretch, strive'

entry.def: If you have to contend with a problem or difficulty, you have to deal with it or overcome it.

example.ex: It is time, once again, to contend with racism...
example.tran: 又一次到了与种族主义战斗的时刻了。

example.ex: American businesses could soon have a new kind of lawsuit to contend with.
example.tran: 美国公司可能很快就要有一种新型的官司去应付了。

entry.def: If you contend that something is true, you state or argue that it is true.

example.ex: The government contends that he is fundamentalist...
example.tran: 政府认定他是原教旨主义者。

example.ex: 'You were just looking,' contends Samantha. 'I was the one doing all the work.'
example.tran: “你不过是看看而已。”萨曼莎争辩道，“什么活儿都是我来干。”

entry.def: If you contend with someone for something such as power, you compete with them to try to get it.

example.ex: ...the two main groups contending for power.
...with 10 UK construction yards contending with rivals from Norway, Holland, Italy and Spain.
example.tran: 10家英国建造厂与来自挪威、荷兰、意大利和西班牙的对手展开竞争

sentences.sentence: "He contended that Communism had no future"

means.word_mean: 3. to make the subject of dispute, contention, or litigation;

sentences.sentence: "They contested the outcome of the race"

means.word_mean: 4. compete for something; engage in a contest; measure oneself against others
5. come to terms or deal successfully with;

sentences.sentence: "We got by on just a gallon of gas"
"They made do on half a loaf of bread every day"

auth_sentence.content: But then they have the trout to contend with.
auth_sentence.res_content: But then they have the trout to contend with.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But then they have the trout to contend with.

auth_sentence.content: So there aren't artificial hurdles to contend with.
auth_sentence.res_content: So there aren't artificial hurdles to contend with.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So there aren't artificial hurdles to contend with.

auth_sentence.content: Publishers and advertisers contend Facebook was suppressing their content.
auth_sentence.res_content: Publishers and advertisers contend Facebook was suppressing their content.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Publishers and advertisers contend Facebook was suppressing their content.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图

stems_affixes.value_cn: 嫩的, 温柔的, 软弱的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向+er→像伸出的幼芽→嫩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
stems_affixes.word_buile: attend[v.出席,参加]+ance表名词→n.出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
attend[v.出席,参加]+ant人→n.服务员;随从,随员
intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图
tend趋向+ency表名词→n.趋势,趋向;倾向
at加强+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→出席
con一起+tend伸展,趋向→一起伸展→竞争,斗争

stems_affixes.value_cn: 延长,延伸;扩充;给予;提供;估价
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→扩张
in内+tend伸展,趋向→内心伸出→想要

stems_affixes.value_cn: 假装,假托,借口,[在演戏中]装扮
stems_affixes.word_buile: pre预先,提前+tend伸展,趋向→提前展开,事先展开→假装,借口
pro前+tend伸展,趋向→v.[使]伸出, [使]伸展

stems_affixes.value_cn: 趋向,往往是;易于,往往会;照料,看护
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向→趋向做→易于,往往会

Sentence.sentence: Knowledge Ecology International contends that the Supreme Court's ruling could have "profound effects" on other biotech industries.
But Schweitzer contends the "mounting causal evidence" linking goal-setting and harmful behavior should be studied to help spotlight issues that merit caution and further investigation.

sentences.en: The firm is too small to contend against large international companies.
sentences.cn: 这家公司太小, 无法与国际性的大公司竞争。

sentences.en: When a marriage ends, the former husband and wife often contend over the children.
sentences.cn: 夫妇双方在婚姻破裂后, 往往会争夺子女。
姐妹们为鸡毛蒜皮的小事而争斗。

sentences.en: I have to contend with difficulties.
He contended that there must be life on Mars.
sentences.cn: 他声称火星上面一定有生物。

jushi.english: Columbus contended that the earth was round.
jushi.chinese: 哥伦布坚信地球是圆的。

jushi.english: He contended that there must be life on Mars.
jushi.chinese: 他坚信火星上面一定有生物。

jushi.english: The police contended that the difficulties they faced were too severe.
jushi.chinese: 警方争辩说他们碰到的困难太大。
